attributes.action: ‘Palm oil’ to be clearly labelled on products containing it, to help consumers.
attributes.background: There are many names for palm oil that consumers won’t recognise. It is not as clear as looking at the ingredients list on a product and searching for palm oil. Some ingredients may be from palm oil but it will not be labelled, e.g. ‘vegetable oil’ in a product may or may not be from palm oil.
attributes.additional_details:
Some names for ingredients that could or do contain palm oil:
INGREDIENTS: Vegetable Oil, Vegetable Fat, Palm Kernel, Palm Kernel Oil, Palm Fruit Oil, Palmate, Palmitate, Palmolein, Glyceryl, Stearate, Stearic Acid, Elaeis Guineensis, Palmitic Acid, Palm Stearine, Palmitoyl Oxostearamide, Palmitoyl Tetrapeptide-3, Sodium Laureth Sulfate, Sodium Lauryl Sulfate, Sodium Kernelate, Sodium Palm Kernelate, Sodium Lauryl Lactylate/Sulphate, Hyrated Palm Glycerides, Etyl Palmitate, Octyl Palmitate, Palmityl Alcohol

CONTAINS: Palm oil

attributes.action: Prevent government from including gagging clauses in contracts with charities.
attributes.background: The government has reportedly included clauses in their contracts with NGOs, charities and businesses, barring the organisations in question from creating 'adverse publicity'. This prevents organisations speaking up for the people they are trying to help. Sign the petition to have this debated.
attributes.additional_details:
This type of gagging clause has been reported to have been used with Brexit consultants, Grenfell Tower investigators and charities working with Universal Credit claimants, amongst others. 
 
The government is systematically silencing dissent, putting self interest above the welfare of its citizens. This, ultimately, represents a threat to democracy.
 
Sign the petition so this can be discussed in Parliament.

attributes.action: Ban pet shops from selling tortoises
attributes.background: Pet shops do not know how to provide the right care for these reptiles and keep them in the wrong conditions also some are too young to be sold and some are sold when they are ill and die later on.
attributes.additional_details: I bought a tortoise from the local pet shop it was way to young to be sold a little time later it died. I'm not happy with the conditions these poor animals are kept in and I would like it stopped. I would not like any other person or the poor reptiles to experience this.

attributes.action: Abolish School league Tables
attributes.background: School league tables prioritise limited targets they are a clumsy statistical tool at the root of a disintegrating education system. Disempowering teachers, and learners, compromising head teachers while hijacking and suffocating the joy of learning at the cruel expense of the learners education.
attributes.additional_details: On line response to a  Question time clip  has made it clear that there is a need for radical reform of Assessment methods to prioritise effective learner engagement. There needs to be a greater  range of assessment methods that  enable and guide the learner and  recognise the many different purposes and evidences of learning while respecting the teachers skills and expertise.This will provide many different outcomes, that will not fit into a one size fits all school league table.

attributes.action: NHS screening for Lung cancer for people aged 55 and over.
attributes.background: My mother was diagnosed with stage 4 metastatic lung cancer in September 2018. Before her diagnosis she had no symptoms and was healthy. She died on October 6th 2018 after a short battle with the disease. She didn’t display Any symptoms until the cancer had speedy to her kidneys, liver and spine.
attributes.additional_details: Lung cancer is one of the biggest killers in the world. Never usually displaying symptoms untill it is too late. Regular 3-5 yearly screening in people who smoke or have a history of smoking or for people who have family history of Lung cancer or other health problems that higher the risk will hopefully lower the mortality rate and give people who develop this disease a fighting chance when it is at a stage where successfully treated.

attributes.action: Stop Councils charging disabled people for the cost of care and support at home
attributes.background: I am 23 years old. I have profound Learning Difficulties with complex health needs. Currently, I live at home with my mum and dad who provide a roof over my head, saving the government a huge amount of money.
attributes.additional_details: The councils are using the term Fairer Contribution Financial Assessment for Social Care to charge disabled people extra money to balance their books. This is an indirect cut to my benefits as well as to my care package. The main principles of the Care Act are well- being, these charges are going to impact on health.

attributes.action:
Celebrate Brexit!
Fly the Union Flag on every Government Building on March 29
attributes.background:
As a sign of our great country regaining her sovereignty and independence, the Union Flag should be flown on every Government building on March 29.
This is an historic day for our country.
Let's celebrate our very own Independence Day every year by flying our Union Flag with pride.

attributes.action: Fund more horse safety signs on roads accessed by horse riders.
attributes.background: Riders across the UK are encountering more intolerant drivers every day. We want the Government to put up more horse rider safety signs to help with the ‘pass wide and slow’ campaign and encourage people to respect the Highway Code.
attributes.additional_details: Myself and fellow horse riders feel that we are discriminated against and our views and safety concerns have not been taken notice of. Our MP has brought the issue up in parliament on behalf of the British Horse Society ‘pass wide and slow’ campaign but the message is failing to get through.

attributes.action: Stop MTC Multiplication Tables Check as a statutory test for year 4 students
attributes.background: The department of education are making testing compulsory from academic year 2018/2019 for year 4 students in the UK. These are timed tests that test all times tables up to 12x12 and are already causing unnecessary anxiety to 7 and 8 year olds in preparation for these tests.
attributes.additional_details: https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/755745/2018_MTC_assessment_framework_PDFA.pdf

attributes.action: Make asthma prescriptions free of charge as this is a chronic lifetime condition
attributes.background: Several other chronic conditions e.g. diabetes, hypothyroidism, get free prescriptions. I am not asking for all their medication to be free just those required to keep asthma under control.

attributes.action:
Introduce laws to prevent insult to 
religions and religious personalities.
attributes.background: The world is seeing a rise in disturbing trends of extremism in society that seek to create a fear, suspicion and hate towards Muslims masked under the guise of freedom of expression, nationalism and patriotism.
attributes.additional_details: Early 20th century anti-Semitic propaganda of the Nazis sought to control the news and information to the people that ultimately resulted in the expulsion and mass murder of millions of Jews in Europe. In the current climate powerful groups of people and individuals have been emboldened by a belief that it is their right to offend, ridicule and target an entire faith community (Islam and Muslims), by creating a climate of fear and suspicion under the guise of freedom of speech and expression.

attributes.action: Increase punishment for any knife related crime
attributes.background: The deaths in the UK over the last 12 months is intolerable and must be addressed. 272 people died and more than 1,800 reported attacks from January to November 2018. There were 40,147 offences in the 12 months ending in March 2018,
attributes.additional_details:
Knife crime is a persistent and worrying concern, especially as it impacts particularly upon young people and the disadvantaged, and various remedies have been tried over the years.
In the year ending March 2018, there were around 40,100 (selected) offences involving a knife or sharp instrument in England/Wales. This is the highest number since the earliest point for which comparable data are available. 268 Homicides- 2017/18 increased from 216 - 2016/17
www.parliment.uk statistics.

attributes.action: Create a demo version of a Universal Credit online account.
attributes.background: To ask the DWP to create a demo version of a Universal Credit online account. With which claimants can familiarise themselves with the online software. Helping to prevent digital exclusion.

attributes.action: Regulate service charges on properties
attributes.background: Unlike, for example with financial advisors, property managers are unregulated. The company set the charge and “deliver” the service. Without regulation, it is near impossible for leaseholders to resolve cases where the charge is excessive for the service level. Regulation is desperately needed.
attributes.additional_details:
If service charge is excessive, current options are:
 
Pay up. Money makes the world go round!
 
Fire the firm IF you can get a enough leaseholders, and money. Hope the next ones better!
 
Formal complaint, court or a tribunal. All require significant time, courts/tribunals require money. Neither likely to succeed since proving wrong without any regulations to define “wrong” is near impossible against their lawyer armies. Also, all formal proceedings are public, potentially devaluing your property.

attributes.action: There should be mental health professionals available to go out to emergencies.
attributes.background: I have struggled with my mental health for many years and believe that there should be mental health professionals available to attend emergency situations that may be mental health related such as attempted suicide and self harm.
attributes.additional_details: Mental health is a growing problem and can affect anyone and everyone. We need the rift support in place to support those in need of mental health help.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for every  child to be taught first aid in secondary school
attributes.background: The uk has a very low out of hospital cardiac arrest survival rate of 8.1% compared to other countries such as Denmark where 22% of OHCA patients arrive at hospital still alive. By teaching first aid we can make everyone in time have the ability to carry out lifesaving first aid

attributes.action: Make it illegal to drink alcohol in all PSPO areas
attributes.background: It should be illegal to drink alcohol or have an open alcoholic beverage within any public spaced protection order so that the police can arrest anyone breaking the PSPO as a deterrent.
attributes.additional_details: Street drinking is increasing month on month along with the by-product of it such as litter, people going to the toilet in the streets, threatening behaviour and ASB.

attributes.action: Children to wear helmets when using a scooter
attributes.background: We need to protect our children heads when scooting. Pavements have uneven surfaces, so as not to single out any children,it should be law that all children should be made to wear helmets.It seems bizarre that there is not a law in place currently to protect our children from head injuries.
attributes.additional_details: Nearly every child has a scooter and they ride extremely fast,often with both feet on the scooter. We need to protect our children's heads. Pavements are notorious for trip hazards-tree roots, drain covers, cracked paving and when scooting at the speed they do, they don't have time to react or brake to prevent the scooter tipping and risking a head injury.  Bones and scrapes heal but a head injury is extremely dangerous and could be easily prevented by protecting the head using a helmet.

attributes.action: add a vegan week in secondary school food tech curriculum
attributes.background: vegan food is often considered bland and boring, but by having a vegan week people will become more educated about veganism and will have a less negative opinion about it

attributes.action: Ensure M55 has sufficient lighting to reduce accidents
attributes.background: M55 motorway near Preston & Blackpool has had more than its fair share of accidents. I believe some of these could have been either prevented or less serious if there had been more lighting available to light up the motorway.
attributes.additional_details: I propose that we all get together and sign this petition to be heard and hopefully make a change for the better.

attributes.action: Mandatory training on narcissism in law enforcement and social services
attributes.background: Training should be required for social services, police, courts, doctors and child psychologists, so people can understand what victims have been through and give the support needed.
attributes.additional_details: The mental health side effects can take a long time to heal, parents need help for themselves as the narcissist will still use manipulation on them and those around them to alienate them from support. The children need extra support networks, if they still visit the other parent, safeguarding issues need to be checked to see if the manipulation can be counteracted or children need no contact.

attributes.action: Routine PSA screening for men over 50 on NHS to check for prostate cancer.
attributes.background:
Prostate cancer is the most common cancer in men in the UK.
This simple blood test that I am petitioning for could save thousands if not millions of life’s. Unfortunately it was found to late in my Grandfather. And I want to change this.
attributes.additional_details: This simple blood test is not routinely offered on the NHS, and I want change to this as it could save millions of life’s just through one blood test. Men over the age of 50 are at most risk so by routinely having a PSA test, could again, save millions.

attributes.action: Ensure carers are paid every hour they are in work place including sleep in duty
attributes.background: Some Local authorities around the UK are beginning to stop paying health and social care companies’ care staff for the hours they are at work (Sleep on duty). Carers currently receive minimum wage for this for the hours they are in the work place. Local authorities have tried to stop this
attributes.additional_details: Please sign this petition for the unsung heroes of the UK. This can have a massive impact on vulnerable peoples’ lives by them loosing staff. Councils are making too many cuts in the health care sector. In 2017 council tax had a rise to pay for health and social care. Where is the money going ? It’s not going towards health and social care if more and more cuts are being made.

attributes.action: Register stillbirths from 16 weeks pregnancy
attributes.background: I believe that all babies that are physically born should not be called miscarriages. It is detrimental to the health of the mother who has to go into labour physically push their child out of their body.
attributes.additional_details:
I recently gave birth to a little boy at 19 weeks, almost half way full term pregnancy. Baby was fully formed but not fully grown, but the hardest thing that I have had to deal with is that I have been described as having had a miscarriage. 
My body did NOT reject and dispel a foetus for natural reasons , ie miscarry, which is why I believe all ladies who have to give birth should be recognised as having had a stillbirth and not a miscarriage. All we want is acknowledgement.

attributes.action: Be commited to holding a second referendum on Scottish independence after Brexit
attributes.background: I am asking the UK government to be committed to holding a second referendum on Scottish Independence, because it looks like we are heading towards a hard Brexit, which could damaging to the UK and Scottish economies in the future.
attributes.additional_details:
And also here is a list of things she plans to and/or could do do to Scotland:

- take Scotland out of the EU against its will, despite voting overwhelmingly to remain. 
- remove powers from the Scottish Parliament after Brexit. 
- they could close down the parliament and rip up the devolution settlement. 
- wipe out the SNP and other parties completely for good in Scotland. 
- sell Scotland down the river.
The prime minister must regard this as a ‘power grab’ if this is likely to happen.

attributes.action: To allow funeral processions to use all Bus Lanes.
attributes.background: I am a Funeral Director based in South London Area and in my time of conducting funerals i have found that traffic in London is terrible. Although we do our very best on planning funerals and always allowing extra time, you can never anticipate 100% on what traffic will be like during your journey.
attributes.additional_details: I strongly believe that i speak on behalf of all funeral directors and families that have been late to lay their loved ones to rest because we have been caught in unexpected traffic. It will ease the worry on so many levels and keep the dignity to the end. Having use of bus lanes, im my opinion and experience, will substantially lower the chances of ourselves, our grieving families and any member of our community being late for the most important journey in our lifetime.....our final one!

attributes.action: Stop charging VAT on gym memberships
attributes.background: stop charging 20% vat on gym membership. The UK is in an obesity epidemic, the nhs is under a huge strain. By removing vat from gym membership, gym owners can reduce their monthly fees, making the gym more affordable, and reinvest into more specialist equipment.
attributes.additional_details: People’s health & weight has become a huge issue in the UK, our health services are struggling to cope. Removing the VAT on gym memberships would allow gym owners to reduce their membership fee, invest into more equipment that will help people with their weight loss & health issues. By encouraging more people to use gyms & fitness centres, will improve there overall health, and reduce the strain inthe already overstretched NHS

attributes.action: Make parking over, outside, or in anyway blocking a drive illegal.
attributes.background: I’ve gone to the expense of paying for a drive only to keep having people park over it or partially block it. The law gives them permission to do this if your car isn’t in the drive. Your drive is your drive and no one should be able to block it. Countless arguments occur daily over this issue.

attributes.action: Enable families to contest agreements made by dementia sufferers pre-diagnosis
attributes.background: There needs to be new legislation put into place covering diminished mental capacity in dementia sufferers. At present the system is inadequate. Trying to sort out the legal & financial implications of an agreement entered into pre-diagnosis has caused our family huge stress, and remains unresolved.
attributes.additional_details: My 81 year old father made an agreement with his neighbours in 2011 allowing them to park on the rear garden of his property. He was diagnosed with vascular dementia later that year. He told the rest of the family he was renting them the spaces, unfortunately after his death we discovered he had agreed to sell them. This agreement was made without a solicitor or any independent witnesses present.

attributes.action: Establish a United Kingdom Ministry of Peace
attributes.background: Establishing a Ministry of Peace would place the pursuit of peace at the heart of Government.  In 2001 in a little publicised initiative, the Government set up United Kingdom global and African conflict prevention pools; bringing together conflict prevention work of many Government Departments.
attributes.additional_details:
A Ministry of Peace would examine how we can challenge the culture of conflict that has grown up in our society at every level, the Government could divert resources to empower our children, raise the consciousness of our communities, and our international partners to ensure that mediation is the first response to conflict. 

"...we could begin the process of transforming the modern world’s first imperial power into the world’s leading peace power...” cross-party 10 Minute Bill 2003

attributes.action: Require restaurant food to be labelled with carbohydrate content for diabetics
attributes.background: As a type 1 diabetic I find it extremely hard to work out exactly how much insulin I need to inject when eating fast food. Guessing my insulin means I may under or over inject insulin which has a huge affect on my glucose levels.
attributes.additional_details:
Unstable glucose levels can have a huge effect on diabetics.
 
The NHS spend over £1.5m an hour on diabetes or 10% of the NHS budget. 
https://www.diabetes.co.uk/cost-of-diabetes.html
 
1 in 16 people have diabetes in the UK which is over 4 million! 
 
It’s a condition that is on the rise which impacts lives. 
 
Severe Complications can occur from poor control - Heart, liver, kidney, eye and circulation problems are just a few.

attributes.action: Free school meals for everyone including secondary school students.
attributes.background: Many parents work extremely hard whilst caring for their children and lunch fees can become expensive, especially when the number of children they have increase. So free school meals can help them save money and maintain the family.

attributes.action: Fund voice altering surgery on the NHS for transgender people.
attributes.background: I feel that the NHS should fund voice altering surgery as part of the standard transition process as for many transgender people the voice is one of the more prominent things that make them stand out in day to day life. Having this would help relieve the symptoms and allow them to have better lives

attributes.action: Allow Pubs/Clubs to have their own policy on tobacco consumption
attributes.background: The blanket ban on smoking in pubs and clubs is illiberal in a society that time and time again calls itself as a free one. There should be a removal of smoking bans in pubs, and the proprietors/owners themselves should be allowed to set their own policies for their own property.
attributes.additional_details: A society that values private property, freedom of choice and enterprise cannot simply impose a blanket ban, such as the ban on smoking in Pubs. This petition is designed to allow parliament to debate the effectiveness of each landlord being able to declare their pub as smoking/non-smoking as they see fit, with the same consequences and restrictions for those who smoke in non-smoking pubs as exist today.

attributes.action: Make all cycle paths and cycle lanes compulsory for all cyclists for safety.
attributes.background: Roads are increasingly dangerous with traffic increasing, Councils have spent millions of pounds creating cycleways which are not effectively used. Cyclists are putting their lives at risk by using the roads instead. Requiring cyclists to use cycleways, when available, should reduce fatalities.

attributes.action: Stop the persecution of the homeless!!
attributes.background:
There are many recorded examples of where council or private security officials have simply disposed of the bedding / sleeping bags of the homeless if they are left unattended.
We want to legislate that, similar to abandoned bikes, this can’t happen without due process to establish ownership first.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/jan/11/newport-begging-homelessness-public-space-invisible

attributes.action: Grant British citizenship after 8 years of marriage to a British Citizen
attributes.background: There have been cases of British citizens being blackmailed, bullied and forced into marriage to obtain British Citizenship. Stronger laws should be placed to stop sham marriages.
attributes.additional_details: British citizenship should only be granted to foreign nationals after 8 years of being together. A temporary British passport can be granted however, the temporary British passport could be terminated if separation takes place before 8 years.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for all UK social workers to wear body cameras
attributes.background: Service users have made allegations with no way of proving if a worker is treating them unfairly. It should be a legal requirement for social workers to wear body cameras to establish if this is the case.
attributes.additional_details: There have been cases in the headlines of children wrongfully removing from their families. There are Facebook groups of parents desperately trying to get their children home, usually without success. There are news articles and court hearings that have exposed mis-information, unfortunately children may have already been traumatised after being removed from their home, resulting in mental health issues, attachments issues and a ruined childhood.

attributes.action: Make it easier for women with infertility to get IVF on the NHS
attributes.background: It has become so hard for women to get IVF on the NHS now and for some women it’s the only hope they have to begin a family and experience the feeling of giving birth to a baby. I personally think it’s wrong for someone else to decide whether a woman can or cannot have a child.
attributes.additional_details: Increase funding; legislate so that every woman has the right to funding for 3 rounds of IVF; and set a minimum waiting time, so women like me don't run out of time to have a baby or have to choose between medical treatment and being a mother.

attributes.action: Mandatory training on self -harm for all those working with young people.
attributes.background: Training can be either online or from visiting experts booked in to deliver a training session. Our hope is that a greater understanding of self-harm will stop it being a taboo subject, which will result in sufferers asking for and getting the appropriate support they need.
attributes.additional_details: According to The Mental Health Foundation (2018) the UK has the highest self-harm rate of any country in Europe with estimates of 400 in 100,000 people self-harming. Additionally it is noted that the numbers may be higher due to people who do self-harm but do not tell anyone about it. Self-harm can affect anybody but according to NICE (2003) the majority of people who report self-harm are aged between 11 and 25.

attributes.action: Make LGBT+ Sex Ed. Compulsory In Secondary Schools.
attributes.background: Secondary schools often completely gloss over or fail to teach LGBT+ sexual education, leaving these students to feel isolated, unaccepted and unprepared. This can have a bad effect on both the mental and physical health of LGBT+ teens.
attributes.additional_details:
Just one in six LGBT+ young people have been taught about healthy same-sex relationships, and they are at a higher risk for substance abuse, STDs, bullying, anxiety and depression. Trans teens aren't properly taught on how to bind safety, leaving them at risk of permanent injury. 

(Sources: The CDC and Stonewall)

attributes.action: Make it an offence to own a cat over the age of 6 months that isn't microchipped
attributes.background: To see a dog roaming on its own causes concern, yet a cat on the streets doesn't? Cats are provided freedom by their owners but can, like anyone get lost, so surely we should have greater protection over them as it became a requirement in 2016 for dogs to be chipped. They're family too and loved.
attributes.additional_details: I helped my neighhour rehome his cats due to illness and provided the family who took them with paperwork, advice and medication (regular flea and worming treatment). Only to find out months later they were found under a shed, near starved and miles away from our home. Many facebook posts of injured or dead cats receive less shares than those of dogs. Owners of cats love their pets equally and it's about time that society recognises this despite their preferences of a pet and family member.

attributes.action: Put fainting and epileptic seizure advice in all public transport buildings
attributes.background: With unprecedented levels of people fainting on the London Underground, I am urging the government to intervene by ensuring adequate fainting and epilepsy advice is clearly signposted in all (or most) public transport stations and buildings so people can be helped immediately.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-london-44953440 
https://www.epilepsy.com/living-epilepsy/driving-and-transportation/transportation
https://www.epilepsy.org.uk/info/firstaid
https://www.standard.co.uk/news/transport/revealed-the-most-common-time-for-people-to-faint-on-the-tube-a3973216.html

attributes.action: A scheme to support banks and building societies to offer 100% mortgages
attributes.background:
My petition:

A new petition calling on the Government to set up a scheme to support banks and building societies to offer 100% mortgages.
attributes.additional_details:
I find it terrible that people can’t get on the housing ladder. People can pay more in rent than others do who pay a mortgage. Let’s make it law that the Government set up a scheme to support banks and building societies to offer 100% mortgages to people who it can be shown can afford the monthy mortgage payment.

Governments under all colours have failed those who want to aspire to provide a loving and constant home environment for their children.

attributes.action: Require fast food chains to replace promotional images with actual burgers sold
attributes.background: We demand a reality check for large fast food chains. They should be required to replace the unrealistic images in their restaurants with photos of actual burgers that have been cooked in the restaurant, so we can ensure customers know what they are paying for.
attributes.additional_details:
Social media - ShowMeTheBurger
www.showmetheburger.co.uk

attributes.action: Make piercing any part of a child’s body illegal under the age of 10
attributes.background: It should be illegal for children under the age of 10 to have piercings of any kind (including ears). A child who does not understand the implications of piercings should not have them. A baby or toddler cannot verbally consent and should not have holes put into their body.
attributes.additional_details: Many people grow up to have uneven ear piercings and believe they should have been able to make the choice over what happens to their own body.

attributes.action: Ban the use of farrowing crates for pigs
attributes.background: I know that sadly the last petition on the issue ended without receiving a debate. Pigs have high cognitive intelligence that has been proven to be higher than that of cats and dogs - it is cruel enough to put them through the pain of death and unwanted pregnancy, but a farrowing crate is torture.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.seeker.com/iq-tests-suggest-pigs-are-smart-as-dogs-chimps-1769934406.html
For those who do not know, a farrowing carts is a metal cage where pigs spend 5 weeks unable to turn around during the pain of pregnancy and a few weeks thereafter. Many pigs go through this process a number of times in their life so are unable to access their young or nurture them properly.
https://lib.dr.iastate.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=1102&context=ans_pubs

attributes.action: Make mandatory that vehicle manufacturers install remotely activated immobiliser
attributes.background: To assist with vehicles that 'fail to stop' for police and being used as weapons in terror attacks, all vehicles should be fitted with remotely activated immobilisers which can be activated by authorities or owners if thier vehicle is stolen or used in crime.
attributes.additional_details: This will help prevent the many deaths we have seen in police pursuits and vehicles being used as weapons in recent terror attacks.

attributes.action: Review the educational system for special educational needs (SEN) students.
attributes.background: Currently I believe the system is majorly lacking. Last year my autistic brother turned 11,  The experience throughout this period in my view was discriminatory, and my impression is that this isn't an isolated case. The government should do more to expand the options for students with SEN.
attributes.additional_details:
Anyone with a disability has a protected characteristic under the equality act 2010. Under s.85.292 it is unlawful for a school to discriminate or harass a child with a disability by denying admittance.
Students with SEN have a health and care plan which means schools on the plan must accept them. However this is forced upon them with little say from the family.
My brothers treatment fell foul of the law, being denied access by numerous schools. He was forced into a special needs school.

attributes.action: Stop documentaries broadcasting footage of individuals without consent
attributes.background: A serious incident involving my children's family was attended by doctors and film crew for a documentary. The footage was going to be aired, without the consent from families involved. I asked for this not to be shown. Police went to great expense to stop it and were unsuccessful.
attributes.additional_details: There are a number of children involved in this incident, the thought of this programme being aired caused a lot of distress. I emailed the production company many times and also contacted our local MP, but he unfortunately wasn't able to stop the viewing. In the end the footage was removed, but the families endured eight months of upset until they were informed. The families involved, with the event of January 2018 had no control of what happened to their loved ones and also after the incident due to the filming of this programme. This is not only unacceptable. It is morally wrong that these production companies are permitted to cash in other people’s sorrow and heartache.
